text:
‚ÄúCrowdfunding is work.‚Äù Interview with Fedor Murachkovsky, General Director of the Planeta.ru platform
07 Nov 2019, 19:15 by Arina Gridneva
From the idea of a VKontakte clone to a service that helps you find money for various projects.
Crowdfunding is the collective financing of interesting ideas in exchange for gifts and bonuses. Abroad, this direction has been popular for a long time: people support initiatives on platforms such as Kickstarter, Indiegogo and others. In Russia, public funding is only gaining momentum.
One of the first crowdfunding services in our country is Planeta.ru. We talked with its founder Fedor Murachkovsky and found out how we managed to overcome the stereotypes of begging, which lots the sponsors usually get in return and why raising a huge amount is not the main thing.



Fedor Murachkovsky CEO Planeta.ru platform.
"Planeta.ru - the story is not only about money"

- What did you do before you headed the Planeta.ru platform?

- I graduated from the Faculty of Jurisprudence at the Moscow State Academy of Water Transport, and a little later I defended my Ph.D. in economics. In parallel with my studies, I was engaged in private business: I had several small retail stores with discs and cassettes.
Then I realized that I could use my knowledge in larger industries, so I began to develop large retail chains: Moscow Jewelry Factory, Rostiks KFC, and Karusel hypermarkets. The latter sold during the crisis to the X5 Retail Group, so for the first time in a long time I had the opportunity to relax. It was at this moment that I began to choose the direction for further development.

- When did you first think about crowdfunding service?

- At the beginning of 2009, we began to conceive a project with a future partner Vasily Andryushchenko and his brother Maxim. We met in the pub - it is in such places that revolutions are launched. We wanted to create something socially useful and work for ourselves, not for uncle. At that moment, Max only joined the B-2 group as a bass player, so he raised the problem of the music business - he started talking about piracy.
The first idea was to create a VKontakte clone, but with respect to copyright. We planned to focus on the donate: if you liked it, you pay the artist any amount. It turned out that at the same time, competitors were already working on a similar idea and it failed pretty quickly.
Then we chose a different path and created a platform for pre-ordering music disks with lots that have different values. For 500 rubles, users could get the disc of their favorite group, and for 1,000 rubles the same album will come with an autograph and an invitation to Meet & Greet (meeting with fans before the concert. - Ed.). And so it all began.
Vasily and Max and I were fairly weak friends with computers and the Internet, so we found a team of programmers who implemented the platform. In 2011, the first project was launched - the Spirit album of the Bi-2 group. In nearly nine months, they managed to raise 1.2 million - this was a revolution. From this moment it became clear that the crowdfunding mechanism is applicable to projects of other categories, so we began to position Planeta.ru as a multifunctional platform.


Co-founders of Planeta.ru Vasily Andryushchenko, Fedor Murachkovsky, Max Lakmus


- Did people immediately respond positively to the platform?

- First I had to overcome the wall of misunderstanding. People said: ‚ÄúOh, what kind of begging?‚Äù Together with the authors of the projects, we did a tremendous job to break this stereotype. Only at the moment when the users who invested money began to receive their rewards, they ceased to keep in mind the idea of fraud. Visits grew by 50% and credibility emerged. Over time, journalists joined in. They began to invite us to programs and talk about a service that helps to bring ideas to life.
When we started, online sales were not so popular. Only 10% of users made purchases using bank cards, although we connected all types of online payments. It was much easier for people to transfer 10,000 rubles to the machine, pay a commission and receive a check, than to pay by card without leaving home. Now the situation is diametrically opposite: users without fear enter details on the site, because they trust the platform.

- What is the main task of the service?

- Planeta.ru - the story is not only about money, but also about marketing and PR. You have the opportunity to declare yourself on a platform with a large number of users and authors. The latter often track other people's work to stay in the subject. In addition, the media monitor our projects in various fields. There are many categories, and not one of them is left without attention.
If on the platform it was not possible to get support, this is an occasion to rethink the product or your financial goals. Perhaps it is worth making adjustments to the idea, thinking about different positioning, or breaking the collection of the necessary amount into several stages.

- How is public finance better than other ways to earn money for the implementation of your project?

- This is not the best way, but only one of the possible. We are not at war with anyone, but simply give an additional chance to declare ourselves and attract financing.
When you are engaged in crowdfunding, the cost of the lot includes not only production costs, but also profit for the author. The main thing is not to make it too big so that people can afford to help you. Thus, you find the end user through whom your project is funded. Sometimes people get extra money from investors, for them a successful crowd-project serves as proof of the relevance of the idea.
A bank loan is also an option, but you will have to give more than you received on hand. We harmoniously integrate into a common string of financial instruments. Planeta.ru is a good way to test your product without risking anything. In doing so, one must be prepared to keep a promise. If the money is collected, the idea will have to be realized and the promised lots will be sent to users. This is extremely important for us, so projects are moderated before being published on the site - we don‚Äôt miss out on ideas that are not realizable.
"It all depends on you"

- What other rules apply in crowdfunding, except for the mandatory sending of the promised lot?

- The rules are laid down in the Planeta.ru algorithm itself. For example, if you collect less than 50% of the specified amount, the money is returned to personal wallets to users. They can withdraw them without commission or invest in another project.
It‚Äôs important for authors to understand that crowdfunding is work. We will not be able to collect the full amount for you, so we will have to conduct a campaign to promote the project on social networks. It‚Äôs better to prescribe an action plan before starting the collection on the site. Think in advance who will be able to support your idea: relatives, friends, bloggers.

- What needs to be done to make the project appear on the site and start collecting?

- First of all, analyze the direction that suits you: business, social initiatives, cinema or any other. Look at what projects users are raising funds to evaluate their own chances, and then start filling out the application.
The appeal should not be very large. It is important to concisely and clearly formulate the idea for which you are collecting money. Tell us what you bring to the world through collaboration with your fans.
The next stage is lots. Pay attention to what other authors offer, and decide what thing you are ready to give in exchange for a certain amount.
Finally, record a video message. This is not necessary, but it will help to get to know you in absentia, to better understand the idea and increase possible interest in the project. Within two days, a manager will contact you to help you adjust the project before release, or simply let you know that everything is in order. Then it all depends on you.
If we notice that the author did not score on his project and carefully advertises it in various sources, then we connect and help to collect more than 50% of the given amount: we place the fee on the main page of the site so that it is accurately noticed, we do the newsletter on the user database, we draw attention to it through friendly media. However, we can only connect when the author has already worked on his own, so you should not rely on support without showing your own initiative.


Fedor at the presentation of the Prometheus All-Russian Internet Prize


- Tell us about the coolest training camps you've seen.

- The projects of popular artists are more successful, because behind their back is a huge fan base. The pre-order of the album "Posolon" of the group "Alice" ended at around 17.4 million rubles. This is a record in one gathering on Russian crowdfunding platforms.
It is not necessary to be a rock star in order to become popular on our site. For example, Mikhail Samin was 18 years old at the time of the launch of the fanfiction print project Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality. He collected 11.4 million rubles and set an absolute record in Russian literary crowdfunding.
Significant sums for the multi-functional animal care center ‚ÄúWet Nose‚Äù are collected by the Nika Foundation: they received more than 20 million rubles from Planeta.ru for construction.

- Are there fees for ridiculous things?

- On the ridiculous - no, but on the funny - there are. Once three happy friends decided to take part in the most ridiculous race in the world Mongol Rally. On Soviet ‚ÄúZhiguli‚Äù they drove from Prague to Ulan-Ude and set all sorts of funny signs on the road: ‚ÄúYou won‚Äôt pass,‚Äù ‚ÄúCall mom,‚Äù ‚ÄúHere is a new turn.‚Äù The guys raised 216 thousand rubles to buy a car and create signs.
It is worth noting a humorous project from the artist Lana Butenko, who came up with the character Cosmozhka and makes two-sided calendars with her: on the one part is a regular set of days with a beautiful picture, and on the other a realistic image of the calendar month, which the artist calls ‚Äúfucking‚Äù. Can be used as an indicator of mood.
A cool and even necessary design project - a sock rollov. The idea is fire, but, unfortunately, the authors did not really understand how crowdfunding works, so the project was not successful due to insufficient promotion.


Recently, Konstantin Kinchev, setting a record for fees in Russian crowdfunding, signed discs and vinyl records in the Planeta.ru office for two and a half days


- What methods should be used to enlist the support of as many people as possible?

- Crowdfunding is not a magic wand, so I don‚Äôt have specific life hacks. It is important to remember that without social networks it is quite difficult to get support, and this is a great reason to develop your own accounts. There was also a case when the guys promoted the project offline: they walked around the shopping center and talked about their idea live. There are options. The main thing is to find them.
‚ÄúWe are always happy to compete‚Äù

- And how does Planeta.ru itself make a profit?

- We charge a commission of 15% percent if the author collected 50‚Äì99% of the declared amount, or 10% if the fee exceeded the specified values. This includes taxes and fees of payment systems, so in reality it turns out a little less. The larger the turnover, the higher our earnings. Basically, we reinvest the profit back into the project: we promote the site so that traffic always remains at the level.
In addition, not everyone is ready to send their fans 4 500 lots when the collection is completed. We can take this for a fee. Such a service requires additional space and capacity, so we recently rented a new office, in which warehouses occupy part of the space.
Another source of our income is educational master classes, special projects with various brands, and the sale of goods created using crowdfunding in our online store.

- How much can you earn by creating a similar crowdfunding platform?

- First of all, you need to think about a niche. It‚Äôs too difficult to develop a clone of our crowdfunding platform, because we have been on the market for a very long time. Choose a narrow direction, such as board and computer games. We also cover this area, but concentration can give new results. We are always happy for competition, because without it it is difficult to develop. You see shoals and are easier to relate to when no one breathes in the back.
Earnings depend on what services you provide to customers. Basic profit - a little less than 10% of all positive fees. We work with additional services, so we get more. I don‚Äôt want to name specific numbers. I can only say one thing: the project is self-sustaining.

- What does the office of Planeta.ru look like?

- We have premises on the first and sixth floors of the business center. Below we occupy about 150 square meters without taking into account a couple of warehouses, and at the top - 350 squares. This is the first time we have taken a rough room without finishing and now we are designing it for ourselves.


The common area in the new office has not yet been fully settled, but already serves as a point of attraction for colleagues: they gather here to discuss working issues, and for cozy friendly gatherings

On the ground floor there will be a coworking and presentation area, where authors can come to record an appeal or hold an autograph session. Here we will place a store where visitors can purchase lots and find out what projects they are from. I would like to create conditions for authors in which it will be comfortable for them to promote their own product. It seems we are doing it.
On the sixth floor there are two large open spaces with partitions: offices of management, accounting, a PR department, marketers, designers and programmers. We tried to arrange everything in such a way that employees could work from anywhere in the office. Some people are assigned to a specific area, but most are not tied to a specific point, so the movement does not cease.
Physically, we are not very conveniently located: not five, but fifteen minutes to the metro. However, the office itself is very comfortable, but for me it is important.

- What does your workplace look like?

‚ÄúThere are panoramic windows behind me, and there are a bit more things on the table than Putin‚Äôs.‚Äù A bunch of pens, a monitor, a keyboard, a calculator and speakers, because you periodically have to listen to something. Here is a calendar on which I change my mood almost every day: today I am a happy rhinoceros, and yesterday I was a sad penguin.


Cabinet of Fedor, his deputy and the head of the logistics service

I drink tea from the author's cup holder with Minin and Pozharsky (a monument to them is the first crowdfunding project in Russia). And also next to me are the music albums of the groups ‚ÄúAlice‚Äù and ‚ÄúVelvet‚Äù - these are lots from our projects. Like all Planeta.ru employees, I am a true crowd-shopaholic.

- Do you use time management techniques to organize your day?

- Recently, my child went to kindergarten, so time management is no longer needed. Every morning at 7:45 am my wife and I get up anyway, and both of them. Such an early climb provides an excellent opportunity to plan the next day. In addition, I have assistants who remind you if any information has fallen out of my head.




- Do you have favorite services or applications that help in work and in life?

- Often I use navigation services and Booking services. I recently discovered the international Drimsim SIM card, thanks to which there is no need to break into new mobile operators in each country in order to stay in touch without frantic roaming. They also have a mobile application, where you can always check how much money is left in the account. Convenient, highly recommend.

- What do you do in your free time?

- I love yachting, fishing, and also watch new countries by car. True, in reality I travel only once or twice a year. More often, my zeal is limited to a summer house, where I board a boat and go to the neighboring island. There is not enough time for tourism, although there is always a desire. As a last resort, I open Google Earth, consider 3D models in different corners of the planet, and at the same time I sign documents and ruin something.
Life hacking from Fedor Murachkovsky
Books
I like to be transported to other worlds, so I read fantasy. I advise "Guard! Guard! ‚ÄùTerry Pratchett and the rest of his books. I look through professional literature in an abridged version. To do this, I subscribed to the Telegram-channel "Book in 30 minutes", which contains the most important squeezes. As for me, this is a universal way, because reading such publications as a whole is rather a waste of time. However, if some book interests me, I can find it in full format.
Films and TV shows
I liked the series ‚ÄúGet Shorty‚Äù - the third season is coming soon. I want to note ‚ÄúBeyond the Boundary‚Äù, because it belongs to my favorite fantasy genre, as well as ‚ÄúGood Signs‚Äù and ‚ÄúTrick-22‚Äù.
I like cinema Soviet. Friends all the time laugh that I am a quote man, because I constantly talk with phrases from old films. Despite this, I love spectacular news: "Joker", "Prometheus". Marvel likes stories too. I began to watch them when it was not so fashionable yet.
Podcasts and videos
I am a down-to-earth comrade, therefore I like to watch the channel ‚ÄúEgorov Lawyer‚Äù. The author is great at managing plastic bottles, making something out of shit and sticks, and then floating on this invention - great!
Blogs and Sites
My interest is limited: in the bookmarks, in addition to our service, only Google mail and the RBC website on which I read the latest news. In Telegram I‚Äôve subscribed to the channel ‚ÄúYour Photoshop‚Äù, and also ‚ÄúWind Power‚Äù - it is about sailing.
